subject: Career
title: The Pivot vs. The Leap
description: Learn The Pivot vs. The Leap in one minute.

hook.text: Some people pivot gradually. Others leap. Both work â€” but the risk profiles are vastly different.

buildup.text: A pivot keeps one foot in familiar territory. A leap jumps entirely into the unknown.

discovery.text: Research shows pivots have higher success rates because they leverage existing networks and skills.

twist.text: But leaps sometimes work better for radical changes where the old field has nothing to offer the new one.

climax.text: Choose based on your financial runway, risk tolerance, and how different the new field really is.

punchline.text: Pivots are safer. Leaps are faster. Choose your risk.

quiz.question: Why do career pivots tend to have higher success rates than leaps?
options: They leverage existing networks and skills
